DataElement.preferredName: Cardiac Condition Antiarrhythmic Therapy Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The yes/no/not applicable indicator that describes if patient has Cardiac arrhythmias requiring anti-arrhythmic therapy other than beta blockers or digoxin.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Having to do with the heart._A state of being, such as a state of health._Agents used for the treatment or prevention of cardiac arrhythmias; they may effect the polarization-repolarization phase of the action potential, its excitability or refractoriness, or impulse conduction or membrane responsiveness within cardiac fibers._An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Having to do with the heart.:A state of being, such as a state of health.

Concepts.definition: Having to do with the heart.
A state of being, such as a state of health.

Property.preferredDefinition: Agents used for the treatment or prevention of cardiac arrhythmias; they may effect the polarization-repolarization phase of the action potential, its excitability or refractoriness, or impulse conduction or membrane responsiveness within cardiac fibers.:An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

Concepts.definition: Agents used for the treatment or prevention of cardiac arrhythmias; they may effect the polarization-repolarization phase of the action potential, its excitability or refractoriness, or impulse conduction or membrane responsiveness within cardiac fibers.
An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Cardiac arrhythmias requiring
ReferenceDocuments.description: Cardiac arrhythmias requiring anti-arrhythmic therapy other than beta blockers or digoxin.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have unstable arrhythmia or need for anti-arrhythmic therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient require concomitant treatment with an anti-arrhythmic agent to prevent or control arrhythmia?

ReferenceDocuments.name: PBTC_Text1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Any ventricular arrhythmias present (besides benign premature ventricular contractions)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: If used, will anti-arrhythmic therapy other than beta blockers or diogoxin be discontinued for the duration of treatment with copanlisib?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient receiving anti-arrhythmic therapy (beta blockers or digoxin are permitted)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient receiving anti-arrhythmic therapy, other than beta blockers or digoxin?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have clinically significant arrhythmia: history of polymorphic ventricular fibrillation or torsade de pointes;, permanent atrial fibrillation (a fib), defined as continuous a fib for greater than or equal to 6 months; persistent a fib, defined as sustained a fib lasting greater than 7 days and/or requiring cardioversion in the 4 weeks before screening; grade 3 a fib defined as symptomatic and incompletely controlled medically, or controlled with device (e.g., pacemaker) or ablation?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient receiving anti-arrhythmic therapy (other than beta blockers or digoxin) while on copanlisib treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 9
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient receiving anti-arrhythmic therapy (other than beta blockers or digoxin)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have clinically significant arrhythmia: history of polymorphic ventricular fibrillation or torsade de pointes; permanent atrial fibrillation, defined as continuous atrial fibrillation for greater than or equal to 6 months; persistent atrial fibrillation, defined as sustained atrial fibrillation lasting greater than 7 days and/or requiring cardioversion in the 4 weeks before screening; grade 3 atrial fibrillation defined as symptomatic and incompletely controlled medically, or controlled with device (e.g., pacemaker) or ablation within the past 6 months?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have clinically significant arrhythmia defined as any of the following: history of polymorphic ventricular fibrillation or torsade de pointes; permanent atrial fibrillation (a fib), defined as continuous a fib for greater than or equal to 6 months; persistent a fib, defined as sustaining a fib lasting more than 7 days and/or requiring cardioversion in the 4 weeks before screening; grade 3 a fib defined as symptomatic and incompletely controlled medically, or controlled with device (e.g., pace maker), or ablation in the past 6 months?

DataElement.changeDescription: 6/24/14 created for Theradex eligibility CRF. jc
